meanings.sent1: The rainy weather made the day even drearer.

meanings.definition: More dull or uninteresting than something else
meanings.sent1: The old black and white movie seemed drearer compared to the colorful new ones.
meanings.sent2: The plain, drearer outfit paled in comparison to her vibrant dress.
meanings.sent3: The boring lecture became even drearer when the professor started mumbling.
meanings.sent4: The faded painting looked drearer next to the bright, modern art pieces.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive task grew drearer with each passing minute, making time drag on.
